result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J Sturdevant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: Defendant is entitiled to Huber Privileges. No Good Time Credit

miscConds.notes: Same repayment conditions as noted in Count 1.
Same conditions as noted in Count 1 with the exception of the jail time.
Same repayment conditions as noted in Count 1.
Same conditions as noted in Count 1 with the exception of the jail time.

Case called @ 2:09 p.m. Defendant Matthew J Sturdevant in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Roth. Statement by DE. Court orders: Ct 1 - S/W 3 years probation - Conditions: 10 months WC Jail - Huber, No GT, No CFTS - Sentence to commence by no later than July 1, 2016, AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Drug buy money in the amount of $1200, DNA sample and surcharge, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Ct 2 - S/W 1 year probation concurrent w/ Ct 1 - Same conditions as Ct 1 with the exception of jail time. Ct 3 - S/W 3 years probation concurrent w/ Cts 1&2  - Same conditions as Ct 1 with the exception of jail time. Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal rights given.

ADDRESS INFO for Matthew J Sturdevant
Current: W13280 County Road C, Hancock, WI 54943   (Effective: 03-30-2016)
Prior: W13262 County Road C, Hancock, WI 54943
From J. Harley re: AODA assessment

2:55 pm case called. Defendant Matthew J Sturdevant in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA Blader makes statement regarding agreement and states on record. Attorney Roth confirms. Attorney Roth requests matter go through plea but adjourn sentencing to a later date-defendant will be entering pleas today.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Guilty to Counts 1, 2, & 3.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Court dismisses and reads in Counts 4, 5, & 6. Court adjourns sentencing and reminds defendant regarding conditions of bond.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 30, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
by USPS - No Mail Receptacle - Unable to Forward

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Susan Marie Roth in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Attorney Roth, requests additional status.  Status conference scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 11:30 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.    Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called late @ 1:45 PM: Defendant Matthew J Sturdevant in court with attorney Johnathon Smith for attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing today. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing.  Def BOT.  INFO Filed - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.   NGP received and entered.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Court orders $5000 Signature Bond.  Status conference scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
